snippet: Greece’s fragile coalition government said that it had identified areas that could be trimmed, but still to be determined is whether salaries and pensions are to be cut further.
abstract: Greece’s fragile coalition government, under pressure from international creditors to cut 11.5 billion euros ($14 billion) in spending in 2013 and 2014, says it has identified areas that could be trimmed; still to be determined is whether salaries and pensions are to be cut further.
lead_paragraph: Greece’s fragile coalition government said that it had identified areas that could be trimmed, but still to be determined is whether salaries and pensions are to be cut further.

headline.seo: Greek Governing Coalition Identifies More Areas to Cut
headline.main: Greece Says It Has Found More Areas for Possible Cuts
headline.print_headline: Greece Says It Has Found More Areas for Possible Cuts
